title.narrative: DFID Saving Lives In Sierra Leone Monitoring, Learning, Review and Evaluation Project

description.narrative: Montrose has been contracted to support the Monitoring, Evidence Learning and Review (MELR) of the DFID Saving lives in Sierra Leone (SLiSL) programme. SLiSL seeks to save women’s and children’s lives by improving the quality, availability and accessibility of reproductive, maternal, newborn and child health services. The programme’s purpose is to achieve a sustainable step-change in health outcomes for under-fives, adolescents, pregnant women and mothers.

Milestone 1 required the submission of the following deliverables: 1. Inception report including logframe review 2. Steering Committee Meeting attendance 3. Break Review Report of SLISL results, data quality and data collection processes 4. Baseline Politicial Economy Analysis 5. Baseline HMIS report and action plan

sector.narrative: The programme aims to aid recovery of health and aims to support priority, cost effective interventions to improve health service delivery and save child and maternal lives.

description.narrative: Milestone 2 required the submission of the following deliverables: 1. Quarterly report inlcuding feedback from filed validation visits, data quality, beneficiary feed, VFM progress, PEA update, MoHS support update and MELR TA uptake; 2. MoHS support plan agreed and reviewed 3. SLISL Reporting guidelines for IPs approved 4. Logframe review 5. Steering Committee Meeting 6. Draft VFM framework 7. MoHS TA in place

sector.narrative: The programme aims to aid recovery of health and aims to support priority, cost effective interentions to improve health service delivery and save child and maternal lives.

description.narrative: Milestone 3 required the submission of the following deliverables: 1. Quarterly report comprising feedback from field validation visits, data quality, beneficiary feedback, VFM rogress, PEA update, MoHS support update and MELR TA uptake; 2. External SLISL learning fora on core themes; 3. Steering Committee Meeting; 4. Annual roundtable learning event with IPs; 5. Data validation and qualitative field study reports; 6. MELR TA portal, MELR dashboard, MELR data store - all live; 7. Data topic papers; 8. MELR research forum established and OR studies and agenda reviewed; 9. SLISL Learning Centre established and final KMC and Dissemination Strategy produced; 10. SLISL Learning kit produced (infographics, multimedia clips and learning sheets); 11. SLISL Learning Centre seminars; 12. Internal SLISL Learning Fora; 13. IP Annual report comprising: programme review, extended VFM analysis report, analysis of HMIS quality, progress report on KMC and dissemination strategy.

sector.narrative: The programme aims to aid recovery of health and aims to support priority, cost effective interventions to improve health service delivery and save child and maternal lives.

transaction.ref: Milestone 4 - Submission of Annual MELR Report

description.narrative: Milestone 4 required the submission of the following deliverables: 1. Annual MELR report comprising monitoring, feedback from field validation visits, data quality, beenficiary feedback, VFM progress, PEA update, MoHS support update and MELR TA uptake; 2. Final Results Framework for phase 2; 3. Steering Committee Meeting; 4. Break Review Report including VFM.

sector.narrative: The programme aims to aid recovery of health and aims to support priority, cost effective interventions to improve health service delivery and save child and maternal lives.

description.narrative: Milestone 7 required the submission of the following deliverables: 1. Quarterly report comprising: monitoring; feedback from field validation visits; data quality; beneficiary feedback; VFM progress; PEA update; MoHS support update; MELR TA uptake 2. Steering Committee Meeting 3. PEA six-monthly update 4. Data validation and qualitative field study reports 5. Quarterly MoHS field visits and topic paper 6. Operation Research Report 2 submitted 7. Quarterly Partners Meeting (Internal Learning Fora)

description.narrative: Milestone 8 required the submission of the following deliverables: 1. Annual MELR report comprising: monitoring; feedback from field validation visits; data quality; beneficiary feedback; VFM progress; PEA update; MoHS support update; MELR TA uptake 2. Steering Committee Meeting 3. Quarterly Partners Meeting (Internal Learning Fora) 4. Quarterly MoHS field visits and data topic paper 5. Data validation and qualitative field study 6. provider-org.narrative: Milestone 6 required the submission of the following deliverables: 1. Quarterly IP consolidated report including MELR 2. Quarterly MoHS field visits and data paper 3. Steering Committee Meeting 4. Annual Review 5. Quarterly Partners Meeting (Internal Learning Fora) 6. Data validation and qualitative field study reports (validation field visits after partners meeting/data crunching) 7. Annual roundtable learning event with IPs (annual review feedback) 8. MELR TA portal, MELR dashboards, MELR data store updated 9. SLISL Learning kit produced (Infographics, multimedia clips and learning sheets) 10. Annual VfM Analysis 11. Subsequent TA recruited based on capacity assessment recommendations

sector.narrative: The programme aims to aid recovery of health and aims to support priority, cost effective interventions to improve health service delivery and save child and maternal lives.
